edu.rit.sha2

Class SHA512Base

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.crst.Computation
      • edu.rit.crst.Function
        • edu.rit.sha2.SHA512Base
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SHA384, SHA512, SHA512_224, SHA512_256

    public abstract class SHA512Base
extends Function
    Class SHA512Base is the abstract base class for the SHA-2 hash functions that use a 64-bit word. It implements a 104-byte (832-bit) message. The cryptographic function's input A is the first portion of the message (512 bits); input B is the second portion of the message (320 bits); output C is the digest (size determined by a subclass).

    Class SHA512Base computes the digest of one 1024-bit block consisting of the message (832 bits) plus the padding (192 bits). The padding consists of one 1 bit, sixty-three 0 bits, and the message length (128 bits).

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate(BigInt A,
            BigInt B,
            BigInt[] C)
        Evaluate this cryptographic function. The function is evaluated on inputs A and B, and the output of each round is stored in the C array.

        Note: The evaluate() method is performed on the CPU in a single thread. It is intended as a cross-check for the GPU kernel.

        Specified by:
        evaluate in class Function
        Parameters:
        A - Input A.
        B - Input B.
        C - Array of outputs C, indexed by round.
